title: Annotation
description: An annotation is comment or markup associated with another asset, either globally or at some specific location. This annotation data model is based on the W3C Web Annotation Data Model (https://www.w3.org/TR/annotation-model/).

collab:motivation.title: Motivation
collab:motivation.description: User motivation for adding this annotation.

collab:generator.title: Generator
collab:generator.description: The user agent that created this annotation.

collab:creator.title: Creator
collab:creator.description: Profile information describing the user who created this annotation.

collab:target.title: Target
collab:target.description: The target referenced by this annotation. For global annotations, the target is an asset. For contextual annotations, the target is a specific position or node within an asset. When an annotation is made in reply to some earlier annotation (motivation "replying"), the target references that annotation.

quadilateralPoints.title: Quadilateral points
quadilateralPoints.description: One or more quadrilaterals, each expressed as four successive pairs of x and y values. (The total number of points in the array must be a multiple of eight.) The points are expressed in the coordinate system of the referenced asset.

items.description: pixel location of the bounding box

nodeSelector.title: Node selector
nodeSelector.description: If the annotation points to a single node in the target asset, or spans across multiple nodes over the target resource/asset, then this field is used.

items.description: Single node that points to a specific location in annotation

collab:index.title: Index
collab:index.description: When present, indicates the item at this array index should be selected. For page oriented formats, the node object contains a single property named index, and the value of the index property is the zero-based index of a page in the asset

collab:id.title: ID
collab:id.description: When present, indicates the item with this id value should be selected. For non-page oriented formats, the node object contains a single property named id, and the value of the id property is the id of the target artboard.

collab:quadPoints.title: Quadilateral points
collab:quadPoints.description: Quadilateral points may be provided for highlights, strikethrough, underline, insert or replace annotations.

collab:boundingBox.title: Bounding box
collab:boundingBox.description: Bounding box of the location in the 'node' (target.selector.node) of the asset (target.source) where annotation on the target resource is made. For many creative or web products, the origin of the coordinate space is the top left corner of the artboard, and the values of noteX and noteY are expressed in pixels. For other types of documents, the origin and units may be defined differently.

items.description: top, left, bottom, right pixel locations of the bounding box

collab:noteX.title: X point of the location where annotation on the target resource is made
collab:noteX.description: For many creative or web products, the origin of the coordinate space is the top left corner of the artboard, and the values of noteX and noteY are expressed in pixels. For other types of documents, the origin and units may be defined differently. The caller may optionally supply values for noteX and noteY if target.selector.subtype is equal to node.  For other subtypes, noteX and noteY must be specified.

collab:noteY.title: X point of the location where annotation on the target resource is made
collab:noteY.description: For many creative or web products, the origin of the coordinate space is the top left corner of the artboard, and the values of noteX and noteY are expressed in pixels. For other types of documents, the origin and units may be defined differently. The caller may optionally supply values for noteX and noteY if target.selector.subtype is equal to node.  For other subtypes, noteX and noteY must be specified.

collab:inkList.title: Ink list
collab:inkList.description: Ink list is useful must be provided for 'shape' subtype of annotation. It is an array of a number arrary.

positionSelector.title: Position Selector
positionSelector.description: This selector helps in selecting a text position range or percentage offset in an image

collab:leftOffset.title: Left offset
collab:leftOffset.description: Offset in percentage of width of startStructElem element from its left edge. Required for sticky annotation on an image.

collab:topOffset.title: Top Offset
collab:topOffset.description: Offset in percentage of height of startStructElem element from its top edge. Required for sticky annotation on an image.

collab:startOffset.title: Unicode character offset from the startStructElem. This property helps in placing annotations over textual content.

collab:endOffset.title: Unicode character offset from the endStructElem. This property helps in placing annotations over textual content.

collab:startStructElem.title: Start structure element
collab:startStructElem.description: This field points to the anchor element in the document object model of the asset from which start offset of the text annotation is calculated. This points to the id of the opaque object (could be a GUID) in the underlying resource (like an artboard in case of a creative product).

collab:endStructElem.title: End structure element
collab:endStructElem.description: The end offset is computed from the location of this field if it is present. Otherwise, the end offset is computed from collab:startStructElem. The default is that collab:endStructElem is same as collab:startStructElem

annotationSelectorChooser.title: Selection chooser
annotationSelectorChooser.description: An annotation target may be selected by any choice of selector implementation

annotationSelector.title: Annotation Selector
annotationSelector.description: An annotation may refer to segment of a target resource, rather than all of it. A selector is used to describe that segment in the target resource.

collab:type.title: Annotation Type
collab:type.description:
node subtype identifies a global annotation that is made on an entire artboard, or page of a document. Such a node annotation does not need noteX, noteY properties described below.
note subtype is similar to a sticky note in PDF - it is a contextual annotation made at (x, y) location on an artboard or page of a document.
strikethrough | highlight | underline | insert subtype correspond to namesake annotation usually made against text in PDF.
shape annotation is a free form vector drawing annotation.

collab:primarySelector.title: Primary Selector
collab:primarySelector.description: annotationSelector does not extend annotationSelectorChooser but composes via primarySelector. This helps if the actual selection requires a collection of selections, possible in nodeSelector.

collab:refinedBy.title: Refined By
collab:refinedBy.description: An annotation may be defined for multiple representations or a specific context of the asset. Example 1: In case of page-oriented format, an annotation may be present at a specific location in a page, or across two pages. A page-oriented format could be rendered/reflowed by relayouting on a smaller form factor (mobile) device. To enable this feature, annotation may need to be represented via text positions and an anchor element/id. Example 2: In case of a creative product, an annotation may be present on an overlay artboard when it is superimposed on top of a base artboard. So, the annotation may need both collab:primarySelector and collab:refinedBy to represent it. collab:refinedBy is only present if collab:primarySelector is present.

annotationStyle.title: Annotation Selector
annotationStyle.description: An annotation may refer to segment of a target resource, rather than all of it. A selector is used to describe that segment in the target resource.

collab:strokeColor.title: Stroke color
collab:strokeColor.description: The CSS color for stroke drawing current annotation object

collab:strokeWidth.title: Stroke width
collab:strokeWidth.description: stroke width for drawing the annotation

collab:opacity.title: Opacity
collab:opacity.description: Fill and stroke opacity of the annotation

annotationTarget.title: Target
annotationTarget.description: Target defines the object on which this annotation has been made. In case of global annotations, it can be associated with complete asset. In case of contextual annotation, annotation is made against a specific position/node on the target asset. In case of a reply annotation (motivation is 'replying'), the target of the annotation is parent annotation.

collab:source.title: Source
collab:source.description:
If motivation is 'commenting', then the value of 'target' is <target-asset>.
If motivation is 'replying', then the value of 'target' is <parent-annotation-uri>
The URI needs to ID-based URI of the primary resource.

collab:selector.title: Annotation Selector
collab:selector.description: An annotation may refer to segment of a target resource, rather than all of it. A selector is used to describe that segment in the target resource.

collab:annotationStyle.title: Annotation Style
collab:annotationStyle.description: This field describes the styles used to render the annotation
